channel.title: COVID-19 on Jack's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in COVID-19 on Jack's Blog

item.title: Analysis: Indiana COVID-19 Infection Rate Disparities
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(corrplot) Introduction The following analysis shows a strong relationship between eviction in Indiana, African American population rate, and COVID infection rates. These populations are at an increased risk of a faster COVID-19 infection rate in Indiana. This analysis is completely reproducible. The R code to gather the data, prep it, and perform the analysis are on my Github. Data Extract We’ll extract data from two places:

item.title: Indiana COVID-19 Case Model
item.description: Indiana Coronavirus Case Model I’ve been working on a statistical model for predicting daily COVID-19 case counts in Indiana. I gathered data from 7 places: https://github.com/RamiKrispin/coronavirus https://www.coronavirus.in.gov/2393.htm https://trends.google.com/trends/?geo=US https://evictionlab.org/ https://www.gstatic.com/covid19/mobility/Global_Mobility_Report.csv https://www.wfyi.org/ https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/rural-urban-commuting-area-codes/ I also manually included the “phases” for Holcomb’s Back on Track plan. Results My model is still in development, but I’ve made some progress. I set aside the last 28 days as testing data and trained my model on the remaining data.
